entities.name: ministry
entities.description: The Ministry is mentioned as the authority that would take action if there was any more magic in Privet Drive.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a student at Hogwarts and is facing expulsion due to potential magic in his home.

entities.name: privet drive
entities.description: Privet Drive is Harry's home address where the Ministry would be monitoring for any more magic.

entities.name: hogwarts
entities.description: Hogwarts is a school that Harry attends and faces expulsion from.

entities.name: dursleys
entities.description: The Dursleys are Harry's cruel and neglectful relatives who live with him at Privet Drive.

entities.name: aunt marge
entities.description: Aunt Marge is a relative of the Dursleys and is visiting them during the story.

entities.name: handbook of do-it-yourself broomcare
entities.description: The Handbook of Do-It-Yourself Broomcare is an object that Harry uses to distract himself from his aunt's criticism.

entities.name: grunnings
entities.description: Grunnings is a drill-making company owned by Uncle Vernon.

entities.name: aunt petunia
entities.description: Aunt Petunia is the wife of Uncle Vernon and Harry's aunt.

entities.name: uncle vernon
entities.description: Uncle Vernon is the husband of Aunt Petunia and Harry's uncle.

relationships.description: The Ministry monitors Privet Drive for any magic activity.
Harry is a student at Hogwarts.
Harry lives with his cruel and neglectful relatives, the Dursleys.
Aunt Marge is not related to Grunnings but Uncle Vernon owns it.
Harry uses the Handbook of Do-It-Yourself Broomcare to distract himself from his aunt's criticism.
Aunt Petunia is not related to Grunnings but Uncle Vernon owns it.
Uncle Vernon owns Grunnings, his drill-making company.
Aunt Marge criticizes Harry during her visit.
Harry lives with his relatives, the Dursleys.
Aunt Petunia makes coffee during the dinner.
Uncle Vernon brings out a bottle of brandy during the dinner.
